t: Proverbs 7
Warning Against the Adulteress
My*pn son, keep my words and*ld treasure up my commandments with you;
keep*ln my commandments and live; keep*ld my teaching as the apple of your eye;
bind*ln them on your fingers; write*ld them on the tablet of your heart.
Say*ln to wisdom, “You are my sister,” and*ld call insight your intimate friend,
to*ln keep you from the forbidden woman, from*ld the adulteress with her smooth words.
For*pn at the window of my house I*ld have looked out through my lattice,
and*ln I have seen among the simple, I*ld have perceived among the youths, a*ld young man lacking sense,
passing*ln along the street near her corner, taking*ld the road to her house
in*ln the twilight, in the evening, at*ld the time of night and darkness.
And*pn behold, the woman meets him, dressed*ld as a prostitute, wily of heart.
She*ln is loud and wayward; her*ld feet do not stay at home;
now*ln in the street, now in the market, and*ld at every corner she lies in wait.
She*ln seizes him and kisses him, and*ld with bold face she says to him,
“I*ln had to offer sacrifices, and*ld today I have paid my vows;
so*ln now I have come out to meet you, to*ld seek you eagerly, and I have found you.
I*ln have spread my couch with coverings, colored*ld linens from Egyptian linen;
I*ln have perfumed my bed with myrrh, aloes,*ld and cinnamon.
Come,*ln let us take our fill of love till morning; let*ld us delight ourselves with love.
For*ln my husband is not at home; he*ld has gone on a long journey;
he*ln took a bag of money with him; at*ld full moon he will come home.”
With*pn much seductive speech she persuades him; with*ld her smooth talk she compels him.
All*ln at once he follows her, as*ld an ox goes to the slaughter, or*ln as a stag is caught fast
till*ld an arrow pierces its liver; as*ln a bird rushes into a snare; he*ld does not know that it will cost him his life.
And*pn now, O sons, listen to me, and*ld be attentive to the words of my mouth.
Let*ln not your heart turn aside to her ways; do*ld not stray into her paths,
for*ln many a victim has she laid low, and*ld all her slain are a mighty throng.
Her*ln house is the way to Sheol, going*ld down to the chambers of death.
